intro: Cyanea angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf Cyanea, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the Hawaiian Islands, where it thrives in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests. The plant is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. It produces small, elliptical berries that are typically green when immature and turn red upon ripening. Cyanea angustifolia is often found growing on rocky slopes or in coastal areas, showcasing its adaptability to diverse microhabitats.
